message.content:
Below is one workable interpretation of how to reproduce the two structures exactly from the provided dictionary blocks (without rotating any block differently from how it appears in the dictionary).

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1)  DESCRIPTION OF THE MAIN (TARGET) IMAGE
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

There are two separate assemblies:

• TALL “TOWER” (Left Side)
  – It has three horizontal “bridge” pieces in bright‐yellow (one at the very bottom, one in the middle, and one at the top).  
  – On the left side, a single tall green pillar runs from bottom to top.  
  – On the right side, three small cubes (red on the bottom, blue in the middle, red on the top) are stacked in a vertical column.  

Hence, the tower can be viewed as 7 total blocks:
  (a) 3 long yellow rectangles (the horizontal bridges)  
  (b) 1 tall green rectangular block (the pillar)  
  (c) 3 small cubes (red/blue/red) making the right column.  

• “HOUSE‐LIKE” STRUCTURE (Right Side)
  – A red arch at the bottom forms the “doorway.”  
  – Directly above that are two small red cubes side by side (filling out a red rectangular layer).  
  – On top of the red cubes sit two yellow half‐cylinders (placed side by side).  
  – Finally, an orange wedge forms the triangular “roof.”  

This second structure uses 6 total blocks:
  (a) 1 red arch block  
  (b) 2 small red cubes  
  (c) 2 yellow half‐cylinders  
  (d) 1 orange wedge.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2)  MATCHING BLOCKS FROM THE DICTIONARY
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Below is exactly which dictionary blocks correspond to each piece (and how many of each are used).  
Remember you must not rotate any block differently from its shown orientation:

● For the TALL TOWER

  – Tall green pillar (left column):  1 × Block #7  
    (#7 is the upright green rectangle with its narrow face forward, matching the tower’s vertical orientation.)  

  – Right‐side cubes (stacked red/blue/red):
      Bottom red cube:  1 × Block #5  
      Middle blue cube: 1 × Block #3  
      Top red cube:     1 × Block #5  

  – Horizontal yellow bridges:  3 × Block #9  
    (#9 is the yellow rectangular prism oriented lengthwise left‐to‐right, as seen bridging in the tower.)

● For the “HOUSE‐LIKE” STRUCTURE

  – Red arch (base):         1 × Block #1  (arch opening faces front, exactly as shown for #1)  
  – Two small red cubes:     2 × Block #5  (side by side above the arch)  
  – Two yellow half‐cylinders: 2 × Block #11 (placed horizontally, curved top facing front)  
  – Orange wedge (roof):     1 × Block #14 (slope running front‐to‐back)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3)  ASSEMBLY ORDER
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

A possible step‐by‐step sequence (simply list the moves in a logical build order).  
Use the template:  { "Step1": "Move block with index …", … }

For clarity, one might build the tower first and then the house:

{
  Step1: "Move block with index 7"      // Place tall green pillar for tower
  Step2: "Move block with index 5"      // Bottom red cube, tower right column
  Step3: "Move block with index 3"      // Middle blue cube, tower right column
  Step4: "Move block with index 5"      // Top red cube, tower right column
  Step5: "Move block with index 9"      // Bottom yellow bridge
  Step6: "Move block with index 9"      // Middle yellow bridge
  Step7: "Move block with index 9"      // Top yellow bridge

  // Now build the “house” on the right:
  Step8:  "Move block with index 1"     // Red arch as house base
  Step9:  "Move block with index 5"     // First small red cube above arch (left side)
  Step10: "Move block with index 5"     // Second small red cube above arch (right side)
  Step11: "Move block with index 11"    // First yellow half‐cylinder on top of red cubes
  Step12: "Move block with index 11"    // Second yellow half‐cylinder next to the first
  Step13: "Move block with index 14"    // Orange wedge on very top
}

That completes a faithful recreation of the target image using only the listed dictionary blocks in their given orientations.
